info.name: Work Tracker API
info.description: Documentation of API endpoints of the Work Tracker application.

item.name: api/
user/

request.description:
Takes a set of user credentials and returns an access and refresh JSON web
token pair to prove the authentication of those credentials.

header.warning: This is a duplicate header and will be overridden by the Content-Type header generated by Postman.

request.description: Takes a refresh type JSON web token and returns an access type JSON web token if the refresh token is valid.

Takes a token and indicates it it is valid.  
This view provides no information about a token's fitness for a particular use.

item.name: update-password/

request.description: Allows Users to update their password by supplying their current password and their new password.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

item.description: Allows a User to update their current password

header.warning: This is a duplicate header and will be overridden by the Content-Type header generated by Postman.

request.description:
Allows a User to register and acts as the creation point for Users.  
On a successful request, a JSON web access token will be returned, to be used when making additional authorized requests.

response.name: Untitled Example
response.body:
{
  "email": "lCDH@LiLeHQmfCyMVFhKOWOSvBsJBBrAq.udu",
  "first_name": "in ipsum",
  "last_name": "aute ea aliqua ",
  "rate": "441142",
  "id": "cc7e6dac-2561-6f61-7d21-5ddc7b2f7b9c",
  "token": "sed labore dolor elit"
}

item.description:
Encompasses endpoints pertaining to the User, including:

- User Registration
- User Auth token request, refresh and verification
- User Password Update

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

item.description:
Encompasses endpoints pertaining to the Company DB Table, including:

- Creating new Company instances (Only staff and superusers are permitted).
- Updating existing Company instances (Only staff and superusers are permitted).
- Deleting existing Company instances (Only staff and superusers are permitted).
- Retrieving both list and detail Company instances (Authenticated users are permitted)

item.description:
Encompasses endpoints pertaining to the Task DB Table, including:

- Creating new Task instances (Only staff and superuser are permitted).
- Updating existing Task instances (Only staff and superuser are permitted).
- Deleting existing Task instances (Only staff and superuser are permitted).
- Retrieving list of Task instances (Authenticated users are permitted).
- Retrieving details of a Task instance (Authenticated users that are also involved in the same Task Project are permitted).

item.name: entry/
detail_endpoints

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

request.description:
Acts and encompasses the main "timing" functionality for entries.  
Once a new Entry is created via the `/api/entry/ CREATE` endpoint, the created Entry can be manipulated (paused, resumed, completed) via this endpoint, after which timing and billing calculations are performed on the backend.

To specify the desired action to perform on the Entry instance, an 'action' value and an 'entry_time' must be sent via the request body.

Where possible actions are:

- PAUSE
- RESUME
- COMPLETE

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

item.description: Entry endpoints performed on a specific Entry instance.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

request.description:
Acts as the creation point of an Entry instance as well as the starting point of the "timing" functionality for entries.  
A succesful request will create an Entry with a status of ACTIVE which mimics an active "timer". To pause, resume or complete an Entry, the `/api/entry/ UPDATE` must be used.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

request.description: Endpoint for creation of "manually timed" Entry insatnces, where user can specify start and end time of an Entry without initiating any "timing" functionality.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

item.description:
Encompasses endpoints pertaining to the Entry DB Table.

Unlike the other endpoints discussed before, these endpoints pertain solely to the requesting User's Entry instances and the Task's they have been assigned. And includes the functionality to:

- Create new Entry instances (Authenticated user is permitted).
- Update existing Entry instances (Authenticated user is permitted).
- Delete existing Entry instances (Authenticated user is permitted).
- Retrieve list of Entry instances (Authenticated user is permitted).
- Retrieve details of an Entry instance (Authenticated user is permitted).

request.description:
OpenApi3 schema for this API. Format can be selected via content negotiation.

- YAML: application/vnd.oai.openapi
- JSON: application/vnd.oai.openapi+json

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

item.description: Acts as the parent folder for all other API functionality
